text:
The wren
Earns his living
Noiselessy
author: Kobayahsi Issa

text:
From time to time
The clouds give rest
To the moon-beholders.
author: Matsuo Bashō

text:
Over-ripe sushi,
The Master
Is full of regret.
author: Yosa Buson

text:
Consider me
as one who loved poetry
and persimmons.
author: Masaoaka Shiki

text:
In the cicada's cry
No sign can foretell
How soon it must die.
author: Matsuo Bashō

text:
Blowing from the west
Fallen leaves gather
In the east.
author: Yosa Buson

text:
Winter seclusion -
Listening, that evening,
To the rain in the mountain.
author: Kobayashi Issa

text:
Don’t weep, insects –
Lovers, stars themselves,
Must part.
author: Kobayashi Issa

text:
My life, -
How much more of it remains?
The night is brief.
author: Masaoka Shiki

text:
An old silent pond...
A frog jumps into the pond,
splash! Silence again.
author: Matsuo Bashō

text:
I kill an ant
and realize my three children
have been watching.
author: Kato Shuson

text:
Over the wintry
forest, winds howl in rage
with no leaves to blow.
author: Natsume Soseki

text:
Sparrow's child
out of the way, out of the way!
the stallion's coming through
author: Kobayashi Issa

text:
Toward those short trees
We saw a hawk descending
On a day in spring.
author: Masaoka Shiki

text:
No one travels
Along this way but I,
This autumn evening.
author: Matsuo Bashō

text:
In the twilight rain
these brilliant-hued hibiscus -
A lovely sunset
author: Matsuo Bashō

text:
First autumn morning
the mirror I stare into
shows my father's face.
author: Murakami Kijo

text:
The lamp once out
Cool stars enter
The window frame.
author: Natsume Soseki

text:
Let us arrange
these lovely flowers in the bowl
since there's no rice
author: Matsuo Bashō

text:
Will we meet again?
Here at your flowering grave:
two white butterflies
author: Matsuo Bashō

text:
An empty road
lonelier than abandonment:
this autumn evening
author: Matsuo Bashō

text:
Spring has come:
the nameless hill
lies shrouded in mist
author: Matsuo Bashō

text:
Spring departing —
the birds cry out and the eyes 
of the fish are full of tears
author: Matsuo Bashō
